page.title: 04Education-A Primary School
page.content: Ilsham Primary School was built in 1871 because there weren't enough schools to hold the children attending school after the 1871 Education Act.It was built as a village church school.Parents had to pay a few pence a week for their children's schooling until 1903.The school was built as a single room for three classes separated by curtains.One new classroom was built in 1913 and another in 1970.Miss Janet Shepherd started as a pupil in 1898 and then went to college to train as a teacher.She started teaching at Ilsham School in 1921,then became Headmistress in 1929 until she retired in 1958.She was still alive at the school's Centenary in 1971.In 1939 some evacuees came from London and the school was very overcrowded.Now there are 125 children in four classes.
